availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky grocery firm, owned by William C. Tyler (senior member) and Edward J. Martin. In business by March 1859, when their advertisements appear in the Louisville Courier-Journal. Dissolved some time before Tyler's death in 1885.

bibl.p: "Death of Wm. C. Tyler, Louisville "Courier-Journal, 26 March 1885, 2. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
"Miscellaneous", Louisville Courier-Journal, 26 March 1859, 4. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
Tanner, Henry, "Tanner's Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser*, (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1860), 249.
